Detailed Description

This file contains implementation of MIN Section Parser.

Version:
0.1

Function Documentation

MinSectionParser* mmp_create ( unsigned int  length  ) 

Creates a new MinSectionParser.

Parameters:
length [in] the length of the section to be parsed with this parser.
Returns:
pointer to the newly allocated parser entity or INITPTR in case of failure.
Possible Errors:
  • ENOMEM: not sufficient memmory to allocate new object.

const TSChar* mmp_des ( const MinSectionParser *  msp  ) 

Returns a current section.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
Returns:
pointer to the data that parser is parsing.

void mmp_destroy ( MinSectionParser **  msp  ) 

Destroys previously created MinSectionParser.

Parameters:
msp [in:out] MinSectionParser entity to be deallocated.
NOTE: msp in set to INITPTR inside in this function.

MinItemParser* mmp_get_item_line ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  tag,
TSTagToReturnValue  tag_indicator 
)

Parses a line for items parsing with a tag.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
tag [in] indicates the tag to start with. If start tag is empty the parsing starts beging of the section.
tag_indicator [in] indicates if tag will be included to the returned object.
Returns:
adress of MinItemParser or INITPTR in case of failue.

int mmp_get_line ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  tag,
TSChar **  line,
TSTagToReturnValue  tag_indicator 
)

Get a line from section with a tag.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
tag [in] indicates the tag to start with. If start tag is empty the parsing starts beging of the section.
tag_indicator [in] indicates if tag will be included to the returned line.
line [out] parsed line is returned through this variable.
Returns:
0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.
NOTE: Keep in mind that, after usage, you must deallocate line because it is malloced in this function. NOTE: In case of failure the line is set to INITPTR

Possible Errors:

  • EINVAL: when invalid value was passed as a parameter.

int mmp_get_next_tagged_line ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  tag,
TSChar **  line,
TSTagToReturnValue  tag_indicator 
)

Get next line with tag.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
tag [in] indicates the tag to start with. If start tag is empty the parsing starts beging of the section.
line [out] parsed line is returned through this variable. If line is not found INITPTR is returned.
tag_indicator [in] indicates if tag will be included to the returned line.
Returns:
0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.
NOTE: Keep in mind that, after usage, you must deallocate line because it is malloced in this function. NOTE: In case of failure the line is set to INITPTR

Possible Errors:

  • EINVAL: when invalid value was passed as a parameter.

msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
Returns:
current parsing position or -1 in case of failure.
Possible Errors:
  • EINVAL: invalid value passed as a parameter.

LOCAL TSChar * mmp_goto_end_of_line ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
TSChar **  c 
)

Generic search for end-of-line.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
c [in:out] indicates starting position when looking for EOL, is set to the beginning of the next line when linefeed is found.
Returns:
position before linefeed or INITPTR in case of failure.

MinSectionParser* mmp_next_sub_section ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  start_tag,
const TSChar *  end_tag,
int  seeked 
)

Parses a next subsections from the main section with a start and with a end tag.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
start_tag [in] indicates the tag to start on.
end_tag [in] indicates the tag to end on.
seeked [in] The seeked parameters indicates subsection that will be parsed.
Returns:
adress of MinSectionParser or INITPTR in case of failure.
  • If start tag is empty the parsing starts beging of the section.
  • If end tag is empty the parsing goes end of section.
  • This method will parse next subsection after the earlier subsection if seeked parameter is not given.
  • If configuration file includes several subsections with both start and end tags so seeked parameter seeks the required subsection.

LOCAL int mmp_parse_start_and_end_pos ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  section,
const TSChar *  start_tag,
TSTagToReturnValue  tag_indicator,
TSChar **  start_pos,
TSChar **  end_pos,
int *  length 
)

Generic start and end position parser for given data.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
section [in] buffer to be parsed.
start_tag [in] tag from which parsing starts.
tag_indicator [in] indicates if tag is included in return value.
start_pos [out] indicates starting position of extracted section.
end_pos [out] indicates ending position of extracted section.
length [out] indicates the length of the extracted section.
Returns:
0 or -1 in case of failure.

void mmp_set_data ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  data,
TSChar *  start_pos,
unsigned int  length 
)

Create a section.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
data [in] which are to be parsed.
start_pos [in] position from which parsing should start.
length [in] of the data in bytes.

int mmp_set_position ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
unsigned int  pos 
)

Set position.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
pos [in] indicates the position to which section parser should go.
Returns:
an error code.
SetPosition can be used to set parsing position, e.g. to rewind back to some old position retrieved with GetPosition.

MinSectionParser* mmp_sub_section ( MinSectionParser *  msp,
const TSChar *  start_tag,
const TSChar *  end_tag,
int  seeked 
)

Parses a sub sections from the main section with a start and with an end tag.

Parameters:
msp [in] MinSectionParser entity to operate on.
start_tag [in] indicates the tag to start on.
end_tag [in] indicates the tag to end on.
seeked [in] The seeked parameters indicates subsection that will be parsed.
Returns:
adress of MinSectionParser or INITPTR in case of failure.
  • If start tag is empty the parsing starts beging of the section.
  • If end tag is empty the parsing goes end of section.
  • If configuration file includes several subsections with both start and end tags so seeked parameter seeks the required subsection.
